ygData.subject: Re: IRL - Languages
ygData.msgSnippet: Mmh as english is my second language (Any Danes here?) and since  I have been on the net since 90 and playing online rpg s since 92 - I know how it is like to
ygData.messageBody:
Mmh as english is my second language (Any Danes here?) and since I have
been on the net since 90 and playing online rpg's since 92 - I know how it
is like to not write perfect english.
Most people are very understanding - That is, when they realise that I am
from Denmark, I have been subject to some english rants in Newsgroups where
people was making remarks about my lack of english skills until I told them
that English is a second language. Many people out there still have the
assumption that everyone on the net are Americans, even though that faulty
image is not so widespread as it was a couple of years ago.
I also tend to excuse my english skills when playing EQ - Just to let
people know why I sometimes write jiberish ;o) Not to excuse spelling and
grammar, I could get that right if I wanted. it would just take me hours to
get even this small mail right and I dont think my boss would approve
*grin*.

Musiker the bard, Bertox.



Please respond to eqbards@onelist.com

Message: 18
Date: Tue, 24 Aug 1999 04:50:13 -0400
From: "Jamie" <bribed@...>
Subject: IRL - Languages

Does it ever bother anyone else that people who say, "Sorry if you couldn't
understand, English isn't my first language," often speak more coherently
than about 70 -80% of the people whose first language it is? I mean, I
meet
people who have been speaking English their entire lives, and I guess its
just degraded from over use. For all of those people out there who think
they aren't being understood, don't worry about it, chances are you get
your
points across more clearly than we naturals do :)


Taluvil
